comment: I took her class online, so I can't speak much about her as a professor. I wish she had extra credit opportunities. Otherwise, the class wasn't too horrible. Homework once a week on WebAssign, quizzes on WebAssign every other week, 4 exams with webcam. Exam 1 was an easy 100, you gotta study for the other 3 though. VERY slow at posting grades.

This professor's lectures are unbelievably boring. There is nothing of substance apart from the slides, which *may* be online, and if they are they *might* be listed as in incorrect name. You teach your self, and tests are taken online. There really is no need to show up after the first day. Grades also go in weeks after that are due. DO NOT TAKE!!

Took this class online and asynchronous. Class consists of 3 midterms w lockdown n webcam (lowest gets dropped) and weekly HW and biweekly Quizzes all on WebAssign, which makes it easier as there are 5 attempts per answer and its easy to find help online. Gives relevant formulas for all questions on the exams, take a while to respond to emails tho.

Do NOT take this professor!! Lectures were slow and unengaging, and she wouldn't know how to complete examples. She pushed back everything so we didn't finish a third of the content. Her breakout sessions were completely useless and she never responded to emails. Only bonus is that the tests and homework were easy if you have taken physics before.

Seemed underprepared for lectures and often flew through important slides, while going very slow on simpler ones. Lectures ended early even though we were behind on material. Very tough class if lectures are not good because the book is very poor and confusing. Did not grade promptly at all. Hard to recommend for 2211. Tests were all MC at least.

For an online class she provides a lot of resources such as free quizzes (100 upon completion), lectures from past semesters, and thorough homework with many attempts per question. This course was basically just math. The final is accumulative and really difficult, don't this class if you don't need it. If you need it she's a great professor.

Took her lecture for this class online over the summer. You will essentially have to teach yourself the course which can be especially daunting in a short period of time. Make sure you attend the breakout sessions as most of the exam problems were derivations of those problems. Grade consisted of HW, 2 out of 3 exams, and a final so do not slack.
Does not grade promptly, cannot update the schedule, can't follow own syllabus , would not take again.

If you want to teach yourself Physics 2, then be my guest. Math is super easy b/c she just recycles questions. Only posts ppts and no supplemental instruction. Do not take her if you do not want to teach yourself physics and have a prof who never responds to emails.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She told you how to do the labs in-depth and also drew it on the board so you didn't have to prepare at all them. She stopped putting in grades after the third lab so grades were just an average of the 3. She will tell you when your answers are right or wrong in class and she will help you do the math and also the procedure if you need it.
10/10 physics lab prof. Explains the labs super clearly and is very helpful. Just takes an eternity to grade but as long as you try a little you shouldn't worry about your grade.

Explained the labs nicely. She was always ready to come down to help with a part of the lab if we needed it. As long as you get the data collected, you're free to leave and turn in the rest of the calculations by the next lab. She does take a considerable amount of time to grade things, though... I have only 3 of my 11 labs graded right now.
great professor, her lab was easy to understand and she was always willing to help students and answer questions. She gives brief demonstrations of the labs before everyone starts

Great professor with great notes and informative lectures. I wish she would give out notes before lectures because she goes too fast to keep up and maintain good notes. Don't underestimate workload or difficulty, there were a couple units that came out of nowhere with their difficulty but all the recourses were there and my performance was on me.

I had her for my physics lab class and she was always very nice. If you are confused about one of the labs she would help you understand it. The labs overall are not difficult. You just have to go by the book. We also had a SI that helped us a lot as well. The only bad thing is that she takes a while to grade but she grades very well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: lab with her is soooo easy and theres no midterm or final. only one person has to turn in the report for the group.
Professor Ngugi is a super nice person but her lectures don't make any sense, she kind of just reads off the slides and spends way too much time on each slide, in my opinion.

Chill and helpful. Come to lab, listen to brief but comprehensive overview, complete and turn in by the following class. (Note that the assigned lab notebook is very detailed). Available for questions, and we had an LA to help as well. Slow grader, but she checks all calculations to give you as much credit as possible. Graphing & unit guidelines!!!
She is not a bad professor but her labs are pretty boring. She helps if you need it, but does not reply to emails fast.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Ngugi is just okay. The labs are easy af, but the semesters almost over and she's only submitted 1 or 2 graded labs. If you don't know what you're doing she'll practically tell you the answer. Easy class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Attendance wasn't mandatory for the lecture, but it was for the lab. I highly recommend attending the lectures though. It helped me get a better understanding of the work. Be willing to put in the work and be kind, you will do well. There aren't many options so she is a good choice.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: One of the worst professors I've ever had. She is very nice, but her lectures are impossible to follow and she makes everything way harder than it needs to be. She doesn't really pay attention to questions or to what slide she's on, she never actually teaches just reads off of slides that also don't make any sense.

She is your average run of the mill professor. The lab is uneventful, but she tries her best to help you. Still hasn't graded any of our labs so I have no clue how I am doing in the class. There aren't many physics lab or lecture teachers so she isnt a bad choice
